title: Graph of Angular Velocity of Rotating Disk

content.question: The graph shows the angular velocity <math alttext="omega" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Ï‰</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as a function of time <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a point on a rotating disk. The magnitude of the angular acceleration of the disk at <math alttext="t equals 2 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is most nearly

choices.label: <math alttext="0.7 radians per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0.7</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="1.5 radians per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.5</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="20.0 radians per second squared" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mn>20.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.3em"></mspace><mtext>rad</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>/s</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
